summary: This is a Department of Justice Morning News Digest from July 31, 2020, summarizing news headlines and legal developments across various topics. It includes a brief mention of a newly unsealed deposition from a Jeffrey Epstein accuser alleging Ghislaine Maxwell was his partner in abuse, within a larger section on criminal law news.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier accused of years-long abuse of a woman beginning when she was a teenager, as referenced in a newly unsealed deposition.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with trafficking minors; alleged in a newly unsealed deposition to be Epstein's chief accomplice and a participant in sexual abuse.

persons.name: Rosalind S. Helderman
persons.context: Co-author of a Washington Post article about the newly unsealed Epstein accuser deposition.

persons.name: Shayna Jacobs
persons.context: Co-author of a Washington Post article about the newly unsealed Epstein accuser deposition and author of another article on Michael Cohen.

connections.description: Described in a newly unsealed deposition as Epstein's 'chief accomplice' and 'partner in abuse' regarding the sexual abuse of a minor.

events.title: Unsealing of Epstein Accuser Deposition
events.description: A deposition from a woman accusing Jeffrey Epstein of abuse was unsealed, alleging Ghislaine Maxwell was his partner in the abuse.

events.title: Maxwell's Arrest and Charges
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested earlier in July 2020 and charged with trafficking minors.

keyFacts: A newly unsealed deposition from a Jeffrey Epstein accuser alleged Ghislaine Maxwell was his 'chief accomplice' and a participant in the sexual abuse.
Ghislaine Maxwell had been arrested earlier in July 2020 and charged with trafficking minors.
Maxwell had fought unsuccessfully to keep the court documents containing the accuser's allegations under seal.
The document is a broad DOJ news digest; the Epstein/Maxwell item is one of many criminal law updates from July 30-31, 2020.
